summary: A letter from defense attorney Christian R. Everdell to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, renewing a request for the FBI case file concerning the investigation of an individual (name redacted). The letter argues the file is now relevant due to the superseding indictment broadening allegations against Ghislaine Maxwell up to 2004, and that it contains evidence related to a new accuser (Minor Victim-4) and a 2016 meeting central to Maxwell's motion to suppress.

keyFacts: The defense is seeking the FBI case file for a redacted individual, arguing it is now relevant because the S2 superseding indictment broadened allegations against Ghislaine Maxwell up to 2004.
The file is said to contain message pad slips initialed by the redacted individual, which the government intends to use to corroborate the testimony of a new accuser referred to as Minor Victim-4.

The redacted individual was discussed at a February 29, 2016 meeting where private attorneys pitched the government to investigate Epstein and Maxwell; notes from that meeting relate to an obstruction charge against him.
The discussions at the February 29, 2016 meeting are central to Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to suppress evidence.
The prosecution previously denied the request for this FBI file on October 28, 2020, claiming it had no relation to Maxwell or the charges.
